headline: Uber Launches Robotaxi Service In Dallas With Waymo Rival
summary: Uber Technologies is launching autonomous rides in partnership with Avride in Dallas, the first official launch for a partnership the companies announced last year.  Uber stock pushed higher in early Wednesday trading.  The service is available in nine square miles of Dallas' downtown and will initially include an "on-board specialist" monitoring the vehicles, according to Uber's announcement.

content.title: Uber Launches Robotaxi Service In Dallas With Waymo Rival

Uber stock pushed higher in early Wednesday trading.  The service is available in nine square miles of Dallas' downtown and will initially include an "on-board specialist" monitoring the vehicles, according to Uber's announcement.

headline: Latest News In Electric Vehicles - Tesla's European Decline as Chinese Brands Rise
summary: Tesla, once a beacon of innovation in the electric vehicle market, is reportedly experiencing a decline in brand appeal among new-car buyers in Europe according to a study by Escalent, Inc. The report indicates that Tesla is losing its edge in design and quality, leading to its perception as a more mainstream brand rather than premium. In contrast, Chinese automotive brands are gaining traction in the market, with increased consumer consideration and trustworthiness. These developments...

headline: Autolane Secures $7.4M in Funding, Launches Curbside Operating System at Simon® Centers to Transform Retail Curbs for Autonomous Vehicle Era
summary: PALO ALTO, Calif., December 03, 2025--Autolane, a leader in autonomous vehicle infrastructure, today announced $7.4 million in funding co-led by Draper Associates and Hyperplane, with participation from LAUNCH and Feld Ventures. Additionally, Autolane is deploying its curbside operating system at four Simon® properties in Texas and California.

content.title: Autolane Secures $7.4M in Funding, Launches Curbside Operating System at Simon® Centers to Transform Retail Curbs for Autonomous Vehicle Era
content.summary: PALO ALTO, Calif., December 03, 2025--Autolane, a leader in autonomous vehicle infrastructure, today announced $7.4 million in funding co-led by Draper Associates and Hyperplane, with participation from LAUNCH and Feld Ventures. Additionally, Autolane is deploying its curbside operating system at four Simon® properties in Texas and California.

headline: Northern Sun Energy and PowerFlex Announce Solar + Storage Behind-the-Meter Project for Prysmian Manufacturing
summary: Northern Sun Energy announces its expansion into the Midwest with the construction of its first Illinois project, a 7.5 MWp fixed tilt solar array paired with 1,050 kVA of battery storage designed to directly power Prysmian's cable manufacturing plant in Du Quoin, Illinois. The facility, which produces copper medium voltage cable which can be used in renewable energy applications like solar or wind, will draw clean energy from the new system, reducing reliance on the grid and accelerating its tr

content.title: Northern Sun Energy and PowerFlex Announce Solar + Storage Behind-the-Meter Project for Prysmian Manufacturing
content.summary: Northern Sun Energy announces its expansion into the Midwest with the construction of its first Illinois project, a 7.5 MWp fixed tilt solar array paired with 1,050 kVA of battery storage designed to directly power Prysmian's cable manufacturing plant in Du Quoin, Illinois. The facility, which produces copper medium voltage cable which can be used in renewable energy applications like solar or wind, will draw clean energy from the new system, reducing reliance on the grid and accelerating its tr

headline: SEC Halts High-Leveraged ETF Plans in Warning Over Risks
summary: In a set of nine almost identical letters posted Tuesday, the SEC told firms including Direxion, ProShares and Tidal that it would not move forward with reviewing proposed launches until key issues are addressed.  At the heart of the regulator’s concern is that the funds’ risk exposures may exceed SEC limits on how much risk a fund can take on relative to its assets.  The letters direct the fund managers to either revise their investment strategies or formally withdraw their applications.

content.title: SEC Halts High-Leveraged ETF Plans in Warning Over Risks
content.summary: In a set of nine almost identical letters posted Tuesday, the SEC told firms including Direxion, ProShares and Tidal that it would not move forward with reviewing proposed launches until key issues are addressed.  At the heart of the regulator’s concern is that the funds’ risk exposures may exceed SEC limits on how much risk a fund can take on relative to its assets.  The letters direct the fund managers to either revise their investment strategies or formally withdraw their applications.

headline: Is Michael Burry's Tesla valuation warning justified?
summary: Michael Burry, best known for predicting the 2007 mortgage crisis, said that Tesla (TSLA) is "ridiculously overvalued." Burry added that CEO Elon Musk's $1 trillion pay package will further dilute the electric vehicle (EV) maker's stock. Slatestone Wealth chief market strategist Kenny Polcari, Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal, and CoinShares head of research James Butterfill join Opening Bid to examine concerns about Tesla's valuation. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: Is Michael Burry's Tesla valuation warning justified?
content.description:
Michael Burry, best known for predicting the 2007 mortgage crisis, said that Tesla (TSLA) is "ridiculously overvalued."

Burry added that CEO Elon Musk's $1 trillion pay package will further dilute the electric vehicle (EV) maker's stock.

Slatestone Wealth chief market strategist Kenny Polcari, Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal, and CoinShares head of research James Butterfill join Opening Bid to examine concerns about Tesla's valuation.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Trump Administration Lowers Fuel-Economy Rules For Carmakers
summary: President Trump on Wednesday said he plans to roll back federal fuel-economy rules for passenger vehicles, his latest move to unencumber the U.S. auto industry from mandates to build cleaner, more-fuel efficient cars.  The administration’s move comes months after Congress and the Trump administration this summer essentially nullified the mandates—known as Corporate Average Fuel Economy rules, or CAFE—by eliminating fines for violating them.

content.title: Trump Administration Lowers Fuel-Economy Rules For Carmakers
content.summary: President Trump on Wednesday said he plans to roll back federal fuel-economy rules for passenger vehicles, his latest move to unencumber the U.S. auto industry from mandates to build cleaner, more-fuel efficient cars.  The administration’s move comes months after Congress and the Trump administration this summer essentially nullified the mandates—known as Corporate Average Fuel Economy rules, or CAFE—by eliminating fines for violating them.

headline: Meet the New AI Winners: Alphabet, Tesla and Even Big Pharma and Biotech
summary: Alphabet  may have pulled ahead of OpenAI in the battle for artificial-intelligence supremacy.  Jordi Visser, a senior managing director for 22V Research, said in a report last week that the rise of so-called Vision Language Models, which can process and learn from images and video as well as text, should be great news for  Tesla  thanks to its focus on robotics.  “The next phase of AI isn’t about more datacenters, it’s about power infrastructure, flexible demand, and physical-world automation,” Visser wrote.

content.title: Meet the New AI Winners: Alphabet, Tesla and Even Big Pharma and Biotech
content.summary: Alphabet  may have pulled ahead of OpenAI in the battle for artificial-intelligence supremacy.  Jordi Visser, a senior managing director for 22V Research, said in a report last week that the rise of so-called Vision Language Models, which can process and learn from images and video as well as text, should be great news for  Tesla  thanks to its focus on robotics.  “The next phase of AI isn’t about more datacenters, it’s about power infrastructure, flexible demand, and physical-world automation,” Visser wrote.

headline: Walmart Stock Rallies, Pushing Market Cap Above $900 Billion
summary: Walmart is poised to close above a $900 billion market value for the first time.  The retailer’s stock is up about 2% today, a gain that would push it above the market-cap milestone and make it the 12th U.S. company to surpass it, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Last month, as the holiday shopping season approached, Walmart executives said that it is winning over more people in all income groups, with the biggest gains coming from higher-income shoppers.

content.title: Walmart Stock Rallies, Pushing Market Cap Above $900 Billion
content.summary: Walmart is poised to close above a $900 billion market value for the first time.  The retailer’s stock is up about 2% today, a gain that would push it above the market-cap milestone and make it the 12th U.S. company to surpass it, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Last month, as the holiday shopping season approached, Walmart executives said that it is winning over more people in all income groups, with the biggest gains coming from higher-income shoppers.

headline: Trump Administration Lowers Fuel-Economy Rules for Carmakers
summary: President Trump on Wednesday said he plans to roll back federal fuel-economy rules for passenger vehicles, his latest move to relieve the U.S. auto industry from mandates to build cleaner, more-fuel efficient cars.  The administration’s move comes months after Congress and the Trump administration this summer essentially nullified the mandates—known as Corporate Average Fuel Economy rules, or CAFE—by eliminating fines for violating them.

content.title: Trump Administration Lowers Fuel-Economy Rules for Carmakers
content.summary: President Trump on Wednesday said he plans to roll back federal fuel-economy rules for passenger vehicles, his latest move to relieve the U.S. auto industry from mandates to build cleaner, more-fuel efficient cars.  The administration’s move comes months after Congress and the Trump administration this summer essentially nullified the mandates—known as Corporate Average Fuel Economy rules, or CAFE—by eliminating fines for violating them.
